info.h2: Welcome to CMDRSB - the application trinity serving CLARIN Metadata
info.p:
CMDRSB consists of
Metadata Repository where all the metadata records are stored,
the Metadata Service providing a REST-style interface allowing to access programmaticaly the information stored in the Repository
and the Metadata Browser a user-interface for exploring the Repository.

Some further resources about CMDRSB:
Presentation about CMDRSB at CMDI-Workshop, Nijmegen 2011-01-17

div.p:
Summary of available functionality of the MDBrowser:
simple search (simple terms, combined terms, phrases)
complex boolean-searches (according to the SRU/CQL standard)
browsing the collections
browsing the (aggregated) xml-structure of the MD records (under "Terms")
search by profiles
search by data categories
perform semantic search (elements of individual CMD-profiles are related via ConceptLinks to Data Categories, which are in turn related in the Relation Registry)
view individual metadata records
work with multiple queries and resultsets in parallel
page through the results
dynamically change the columns displaying the fields of the records
use auto-columns (if you select no columns, MDService will try to select the 6 most useful)
Explanation of the usage/functionality of individual user-interface elements:

Terms combine information from MDRepository, Component Registry, Data Category Registries (isocat, dublincore) and Relation Registry to allow to search by profiles or data categories, or even perform semantic search.
Thus you can search in the fields of individual profiles instantiated as the MDrecords in the repository, or search over multiple profiles via data categories.
Overview of all profiles and components defined in the Component Registry. (Proxy to Component Registry)
Form for entering the query. Either a simple or complex query. See example queries for an overview of possible query types.

dl.dd:
complex queries according to SRU/CQL-standard
Basic search clause consists of: index relation term, e.g. dc.title any system. You can combine these search clauses with boolean operators (AND, OR), to more complex queries.

div.p:
Both parts can be used in parallel - i.e. you can specify some terms for full-text search and further refine them with filters on specific indices - the two parts being combined with boolean AND (the matching records have to satisfy both parts of the query.). So the general syntax of the queries feasible within the query input is:
simple-query AND (XQ1 or XQ2) AND (XQ3 or XQ4 or ...) AND ...
XQ := index relation term

dd.p: The Collections and Terms are updated accordingly (but this can take a few seconds).

This option provides a summary of the profiles used in the (whole) result and of the (XML-structure of the) displayed part of the result, but it obviously makes you wait a bit longer (Usually 20-50% penalty on the query-duration, but may be worse for queries returning large results.)
